dev.teamcyan.dungeoncrafter.screens

Class CreditsScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • dev.teamcyan.dungeoncrafter.screens.BaseScreen
      • dev.teamcyan.dungeoncrafter.screens.CreditsScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.InputProcessor, com.badlogic.gdx.Screen

    public class CreditsScreen
extends BaseScreen
    Screen which is called when the game was successfully completed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CreditsScreen

        public CreditsScreen(DungeonCrafter controller,
                     GameModel model)
        Setup initial credits screen. Initializes all labels.
        Parameters:
        controller - instance of the DungeonCrafter class
        model - instance of the current GameModel class

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        Create a scheduler which continuously updates a timer. Timer serves as reference for continuous screen updates.
        Overrides:
        init in class BaseScreen

      • draw

        public void draw(float delta)
        Continuously update label positions to create credit lieke moving visualization
        Overrides:
        draw in class BaseScreen
        Parameters:
        delta - amount of time that passed since last call

      • keyDown

        public boolean keyDown(int keycode)
        Implement for keyboard inputs. Called immediately on key presses.
        Parameters:
        keycode - the code of the key that was clicked. One of Input.Keys.
        Returns:
        boolean whether the input was processed

      • keyUp

        public boolean keyUp(int keycode)
        Implement for keyboard inputs. Called immediately on key releases.
        Parameters:
        keycode - the code of the key that was clicked. One of Input.Keys.
        Returns:
        boolean whether the input was processed

      • keyTyped

        public boolean keyTyped(char character)
        Implement for keyboard inputs. Called when a key was typed.
        Parameters:
        character - the character that was typed
        Returns:
        boolean whether the input was processed

      • touchDown

        public boolean touchDown(int screenX,
                         int screenY,
                         int pointer,
                         int button)
        Implement for screen clicks or touches. Called immediately on screen press.
        Parameters:
        screenX - x-coordinate of the click. Origin is in the upper left corner.
        screenY - y-coordinate of the click. Origin is in the upper left corner.
        pointer - the pointer for the event.
        button - the button for the event.
        Returns:
        boolean whether the input was processed

      • touchUp

        public boolean touchUp(int screenX,
                       int screenY,
                       int pointer,
                       int button)
        Implement for screen clicks or touches. Called immediately on screen release.
        Parameters:
        screenX - x-coordinate of the click. Origin is in the upper left corner.
        screenY - y-coordinate of the click. Origin is in the upper left corner.
        pointer - the pointer for the event.
        button - the button for the event.
        Returns:
        boolean whether the input was processed

      • touchDragged

        public boolean touchDragged(int screenX,
                            int screenY,
                            int pointer)
        Implement for screen clicks or touches. Called when mouse or finger was dragged.
        Parameters:
        screenX - x-coordinate of the event. Origin is in the upper left corner.
        screenY - y-coordinate of the event. Origin is in the upper left corner.
        pointer - the pointer for the event.
        Returns:
        boolean whether the input was processed

      • mouseMoved

        public boolean mouseMoved(int screenX,
                          int screenY)
        Called when the mouse was moved without any buttons being pressed. Will not be called on iOS.
        Parameters:
        screenX - x-coordinate of the event. Origin is in the upper left corner.
        screenY - y-coordinate of the event. Origin is in the upper left corner.
        Returns:
        boolean whether the input was processed
